title: How can technology be helpful as a sales tool? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is really helpful and important for many B2B sales-led organizations, the technology a prospect uses can be a strong qualifying factor. Technographics is the profiling of target accounts based on their technology stack. Such profiling allows you to answer questions like: What hardware or software do our target audience use?Do they have remarketing technology installed on their website?Do they use a marketing stack or all-in-one marketing automation?Historically, the collection of technographic data was conducted through two mediums: surveys and scraping. You can use such technology data thru lead databases. For example, Uplead allows you to build such targeted lists of prospects based on the technology stack that companies and contacts use.It tracks over 16,000 technologies like analytics, CRM, marketing automation toolsSo, for example, If you want to find organizations that use WordPress or Salesforce, for example, you can build a list of those companies. Here is how it looks like:  Here are key ways sales teams can use technographic data to create hyper-targeted audience segments, understand the pains of your customers and personalize your marketing outreach for B2B marketers: What Are Technographics & How to Target Accounts Using Technology Tracking Granular Customer Segments - By profiling your existing customers, you can create a bigger picture of their technology stack and the tools they use to solve problems relevant to your value proposition.Account-Based Marketing - When you speak to a prospect on a one-to-one basis, they feel like you truly get them. This is an area that technographics can fuel.Sales Prioritization - With a deeper firmographic and technographic profile of your audience, you can able to prioritize target accounts and lead distribution.News-Driven Campaigns - New announcements and press releases based on technographics provide opportunities to reach out to your prospects and target accounts.Personalized Customer Journeys - By optimizing the entire inbound marketing funnel and customer journey to better nurture leads. The journey you take customers on depends on the technographic data you identified.

There are dozens of amazing software products that serve as an illustrative example of how technology can facilitate your sales process. It will just suffice to mention Salesforce! This piece of software alone has changed the way we do sales forever. And it’s hard to think of any sales task which wouldn’t benefit from using technology automation.  Take sales prospecting for example. It is one of the sales tasks that is definitely better with technology (and I’ve done manual email prospecting for several months, I know what I’m talking about!) And here’s why. Automation saves your time. Prospecting is by far the most time-consuming sales task. Reaching out to prospects one by one could take days! With email automation tools like Reply, you can set up and launch a campaign in under an hour (or even faster if you have a ready-made template and list of prospects).Technology helps you better allocate your resources. In business, time is money. Considering how time-consuming manual prospecting is, this task might cost you a pretty penny. Technology, on the other hand, can help you make the most out of your available resources (both, monetary and human) by offering a smarter way to allocate those resources.It takes care of the routine processes so you can focus on more important tasks. Following up with each prospect who doesn’t reply after the first email might become a challenge, especially if you are doing this at scale. Technology makes SDRs’ life a lot easier by taking care of the routine, labor-intensive tasks and also allows you to easily scale your email prospecting efforts.Plus, automation software can collect tons of data so you can draw actionable insights from your metrics and tailor your strategy accordingly for better performance.  On the downside, there are also certain drawbacks of automation as well as some tasks you can’t possibly automate. For example, if a prospect responds to your cold email, you will need to jump in and take it from there. A machine, no matter how intelligent, simply can’t handle the specifics of human communication, especially in sales.  P.S. I’ve talked about the benefits of sales automation in more detail in one of my previous replies - What are the most common ways that sales automation can benefit your business? If you fancy a read, there’s also a great article about the impact automation has on sales communications - Automation, AI and the Future of Communications Hope this helps!

It can be extremely helpful! For starters, powerful software can automate otherwise time-consuming tasks: help you generate leads, give you access to relevant data about your prospects & customers, and, essentially, increase the productivity of your sales team.  Take CloudTalk, as an example. It doesn’t only make it possible to make and receive any sales-related calls from any place in the world, but also lets sales agents talk longer and “more effectively” thanks to post-call automation, and keeping customer data consistent & up-to-date between all systems. Harmonizely, on the other hand, allows your prospects and customers to easily schedule meetings with the members of your sales team. The only thing you have to do is to share a dedicated link with others and stop wasting time on exchanging unnecessary emails back and forth. There are plenty of useful tools that can help your sales team immensely, which is why I highly recommend doing your research and test out at least a few solutions to see what works best for you. There’s often a free trial available, so you don’t need to make any investments at this point.

Business transformation should start with the process redesign, followed by understanding the information needs and requirements. Based on these we can identify the technology that will enable them. Last, but not east we should consider the impact on the sales people – what is changing, the new capabilities they need to learn, the new behaviors we expect from them to exercise in order the transformation to be successful and to deliver the desired impact. Over the past few years, we witness a rapid, even disruptive development in the technology platforms that can be a great enabler to the sales people. Cloud based solutions allow access of information in real-time, anywhere, and anytime. Big data allows us to identify patterns and buying behaviors, increase predictability and have more objective view on our business performance.
